alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 10:07PM PST until January 18 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Schweitzer Mountain Road, Downtown Spokane, Eastport, Airway Heights, Coeur d`Alene, Springdale-Hunters Road, Metaline, Plummer, Davenport, Clark Fork, Flowery Trail Road, Metaline Falls, Tiger, Fairfield, Orin-Rice Road, Ione, Sandpoint, Genesee, Hayden, Bonners Ferry, Kettle Falls, Worley, Cheney, Northport, Chewelah, Rockford, Deer Park, Athol, Colville, Newport, Spokane Valley, Potlatch, Priest River, Fruitland, Post Falls, and Moscow. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
